review: If you're looking to unplug from the cable industry, choose the Roku. It's better than the Chromecast as you don't have to use your computer to operate it. It operates on it's own and fits nicely behind any wall-mounted TV.
author: Tim W.

review: If you have an IOS or Android device, download the Roku app before installing your Roku stick.  That way you'll be able to use your keyboard to enter email addresses and passwords when installing your Roku.  Otherwise, the input is antiquated .. up, down, sideways, choose a letter, enter .. begin again!  Also, the app gives you an alternate remote for when you lose the "real" one ..  Installation was simple and straightforward, except for the data entry method.

review: Very happy with this Roku. Amazingly easy to install and get it activated and running. I was also able to download a Roku app for my kindle that allows me to use my Kindle as the keyboard for typing in searches as well as an auxiliary remote. I'm very pleased to be able to stream Amazon Prime and my Acorn TV directly to my TV rather than watching shows on my computer.  Still exploring other channels available, but there is definitely an interesting selection.
